Description: Joined fragments of body of Clazomenian (related) black-figure painted pottery amphora (Knipovitch class). Forepart of winged horse. Purple and white alternately for feathers of wing. White dots for bridle and rein, on chest-strap, at base of feathers; white on ornaments hanging from chest-strap.
Curator's comments: BSA xlvii, 13 6-E III. 1. S. Weber attributes this to either the Knipovitch Class or the Temrijuk Group. Compare the motif of winged horses on the amphora in Athens 12713 (Cook-Dupont 1998, 103 n.12.5); compare with the fragment from Clazomenai, KLAZ-1980-T10 (Özer 2004, 204 n.7; 212 Cat. n.7)
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 591, 3)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxi, 11)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 178)
